channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: National Eosinophilic Week
item.description:
Sunday, August 6, 2023

City Hall will be lit Purple and Pink to support National Eosinophilic Week.

National Eosinophilic Week (6-12 August 2023) incorporates Top 8 Challenge day (8 August 2023) to raise awareness for eosinophilic gastrointestinal diseases (EGIDs) and raise funds for medical research. Eosinophilic gastrointestinal diseases (EGIDs) affect as many as 1 in 1,000 people and impact greatly on quality of life.

ausEE Inc. is Australia’s peak national support and patient advocacy organisation representing Australians living with an eosinophilic disease. We are a registered Australia wide charity whose mission is to improve the lives of those affected by eosinophilic diseases through providing support, evidence-based information, resources, advocacy and by campaigning to raise awareness and funds for research in Australia.

This Light Up is organised by: ausEE Incorporated

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: FIFA Women's World Cup
item.description:
Monday, August 7, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Green and Gold to celebrate FIFA Women's World Cup – Round of 16.

The excitement is building for the 2023 FIFA Women’s World Cup as we head into the Finals with Australia into the Round of 16!

Brisbane/Meanjin is proud to host the tonight’s Round of 16 Match, as Nigeria take on England, and our own Matildas will play Denmark in Sydney. If you can’t get to the game, head to the Fan Festival™ at South Bank Parklands to watch it live as well as enjoying an exciting program of music, entertainment, food and games.

Find out more at FIFA Women’s World Cup Australia & New Zealand 2023™.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: 2023 National Stroke Week
item.description:
Tuesday, August 8, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue and Green to support 2023 National Stroke Week.

National Stroke Week is Stroke Foundation’s annual awareness campaign encouraging all Australians to take action to prevent, treat and be aware of stroke. 

The 2023 campaign, Fighting Stroke Together, is a treatment focused theme encouraging people to recognise the F.A.S.T. (Face, Arm, Speech, Time) signs of stroke, and call an ambulance immediately, thereby potentially saving a life.

This Light Up is organised by: National Stroke Foundation

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Singapore Independence Day
item.description:
Wednesday, August 9, 2023

City Hall will be lit Red and White to recognise the 58th year of Independence of the Republic of Singapore.

Commemorating 58 years since Singapore gained separation from Malaysia and became a sovereign nation on August 9, 1965.

This Light Up is organised by: Singapore Business Group (Australia) Inc



Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: 70th Anniversary Blue Care-Blue Nursing Service
item.description:
Thursday, August 10, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue to celebrate 70th Anniversary Blue Care-Blue Nursing Service.

Blue Care is a Queensland Icon. For 70 years, Blue Care has been the leading aged care provider in Queensland, creating a shared ownership and identification with Blue Nursing/Blue Care.

Local celebrations will take place across key regions in Queensland marking the 70th anniversary of the origins of Blue Care/Blue Nursing Service. The Blue Nursing Service originated in West End Brisbane in 1953 and since those early days, Blue Care has expanded its range of services, and now conducts over 3 million care visits a year in Queensland.

This Light Up is organised by: UnitingCare Queensland

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Ekka
item.description:
Friday, August 11, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Green to support Ekka.

The Royal Queensland Show (Ekka) is Queensland's largest annual event, bringing the country and city together since 1876. Over 9 full day, this key event celebrates and champions agriculture and the critical role it plays in our everyday lives, including Peoples day on August 16.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: FIFA Women's World Cup - Quarter Final at Suncorp
item.description:
Saturday, August 12, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Pink, Green, White, Light Blue, Yellow and Orange to celebrate FIFA Women's World Cup - Quarter Final at Suncorp.

The 2023 FIFA Women’s World Cup has been co-hosted across venues in Aotearoa/New Zealand and Australia and now it’s time for the Finals! 

Brisbane/Meanjin is proud to host the Quarter Final but if you can’t get to the game, head to the Fan Festival™ at South Bank Parklands, to watch it live as well as enjoying an exciting program of music, entertainment, food and games.  

Find out more at FIFA Women’s World Cup Australia & New Zealand 2023™.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: India Independence Day
item.description:
Tuesday, August 15, 2023

City Hall will be lit White Orange and Green to recognise India Independence Day.

Celebrating 77 years of India Independence Day. It is celebrated on August 15 every year to commemorate India's freedom from the British rule in 1947.

This Light Up is organised by: GOPIO Qld

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Eve of Vietnam Veterans’ Day
item.description:
Thursday, August 17, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Gold to recognise the eve of the 50th Anniversary of Vietnam Veterans’ Day.

This year on Vietnam Veterans’ Day, Friday 18 August 2023, we mark the 50th anniversary of the end of Australia’s involvement in the Vietnam War. Australians played a significant role during the Vietnam War, with over 60,000 ground troops, air force and navy personnel serving in Vietnam from 1962 to 1973.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Premier & Cabinet



Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Eve Of Afghanistan Independence Day
item.description:
Friday, August 18, 2023

Sandgate Hall will be lit Black, Green and Red to recognise Eve Of Afghanistan Independence Day.

On the 19th of August 1919, Afghanistan declared its Independence with the Treaty of Rawalpindi, a date that is celebrated as its National Day annually.

This Light Up is organised by: Women’s Empowerment and Leadership Association

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate

item.title: National Day of Action against Bullying and Violence
item.description:
Friday, August 18, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Orange to support National Day of Action against Bullying and Violence.

The Australian Schools Anti-Bullying Collective (ASAC), is a joint national project lead and managed by the Queensland Department of Education on behalf of all state and territory education jurisdictions (including Catholic and Independent schooling sectors). We support Australian schools to counter bullying, harassment and violence through evidence-informed advice and resources, and initiatives such as the annual National Day of Action against Bullying and Violence (NDA).

The National Day of Action against Bullying and Violence (NDA) is Australia's key school initiative against bullying and violence.? The theme for 2023 is Growing connections which promotes the importance of school, family and community connections to build safe and supportive learning environments where all students can belong, feel accepted and respected. Through the NDA, Australian schools receive evidence-informed advice and resources to prevent and respond to school bullying. The NDA is a significant national event, with over 68% of all Australian schools, and 100% of Queensland state schools, registered to participate in the day. The NDA campaign is also supported and acknowledged by a significant number of school community and support organisations across the nation.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian Schools Anti-Bullying Collective

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: FIFA Women's World Cup - Third Place Final
item.description:
Saturday, August 19, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Pink, Green, White, Light Blue, Yellow and Orange to celebrate FIFA Women's World Cup - Third Place Final.

The 2023 FIFA Women’s World Cup has been co-hosted across venues in Aotearoa/New Zealand and Australia and now it’s time for the Finals! 

Brisbane/Meanjin is proud to host the Third Place Final but if you can’t get to the game, head to the Fan Festival™ at South Bank Parklands, to watch it live as well as enjoying an exciting program of music, entertainment, food and games. 

Find out more at FIFA Women’s World Cup Australia & New Zealand 2023™.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Queensland Road Safety Week
item.description:
Monday, August 21, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Yellow to support Queensland Road Safety Week.

“Road Safety Starts with Me.”  With 299 lives lost on Queensland roads through 2022 - the highest since 2009 - road safety is a key priority for our state. Queensland Road Safety Week (QRSW) is an annual initiative led by TMR with the Queensland Police Service and is designed to raise awareness of road safety through a range of activities and promotions.

This Light Up is organised by: Dept of Transport and Main Roads

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Brain Injury Awareness Week
item.description:
Tuesday, August 22, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support Brain Injury Awareness Week.

The annual Brain Injury Awareness Week raises awareness of brain injury and its impact. The week also celebrates the achievements of those living with a brain injury and the commitment given to them by their families and the communities they live in.

Synapse is Australia’s Brain Injury Organisation, providing a range of support services for people who have been impacted by brain injury and disability. These services promote quality of life, self-determination, and choice through information, specialist support, and targeted research activities.

This Light Up is organised by: Synapse Australia

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Brisbane Fashion Festival
item.description:
Tuesday, August 22, 2023

City Hall will be lit Red, White and Blue to support Brisbane Fashion Festival.

The annual Brisbane Fashion Festival which will be held at City Hall/King George Square Tuesday 22 - Thursday 24 August, 2023. The Festival is designed to support the local fashion and retail scene at the time when new season fashions land in store, and support our emerging designers along with our established designers and retailers.

This Light Up is organised by: Lindsay Bennett Marketing Pty Ltd

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Eve of 9 years to 2032 Paralympics
item.description:
Wednesday, August 23, 2023

Sandgate Hall will be lit Green and Gold to support Eve of 9 years to 2032 Paralympics.

24 August 2023 marks 9 years to the start  Brisbane 2032 Paralympic games. The Brisbane 2032 Paralympic Games will create a legacy, which aligns with Council’s commitment to making the Brisbane of tomorrow even better than the Brisbane of today.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate

item.title: Australian South Sea Islander Day of Recognition
item.description:
Friday, August 25, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit White, Blue, Yellow, Green and Black to support Australian South Sea Islander Day of Recognition.

The Australian South Sea Islander Day of National Recognition, celebrated on August 25th, marks the day that the Federal Government officially recognised Australian South Sea Islander (ASSI) as a distinct cultural group. The ASSI Community aims to recognise this culturally significant occasion's anniversary to increase recognition and raise awareness of our unique history and culture and to pay respect to our South Sea Islander Ancestors and Forebearers.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian South Sea Islanders United Council

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Dress to Express Day
item.description:
Friday, August 25, 2023

Sandgate Hall will be lit Purple and Orange to support Dress to Express Day.

"Dress to Express" Day will be the last event of Brisbane Fashion Festival and will take place in Queen St Mall and in schools/workplaces across Queensland. On this day, community members are encouraged to dress to express their unique style, in solidarity with DV survivors who are taking back control of their lives including, for many, what they choose to wear.

This Light Up is organised by: Beyond DV Ltd

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate

item.title: Legacy Appeal Week
item.description:
Monday, August 28, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red Blue White to support Legacy Appeal Week.

Legacy supports 40,000 partners and children of veterans who gave their lives or health serving our country
The Legacy Week appeal has been running since the 1940’s and is a time for all Australians to show their support for the widows and children whose loved ones have served our country. See also https://www.legacy.com.au/legacy-week/.

This Light Up is organised by: Legacy Club of Brisbane

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
